text: Tap at Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours golden amber with no head. Aroma of fruit, syrup, apples, hop, and caramel. Light sweetness, medium bitterness, light sour. Light body, slight oily texture, average carbonation.
Aus dem Fass in der Mikkeller Bar Berlin 2017-03 getrunken. Gut gemmachte typisches Lambik. Lecker.
Growler fill from Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Hazy yellow with thin head. Sour with grain, bread, grass, grapes, oak and citrus. Dry with medium bitterness and low carbonation.
In Berlin bar as Mittespontenalle. Clean gold with a thin head. Aroma of crushed apple. Flavour is dry sour, salty, citrus on a very tart grain finish.
Tap. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of funk, slight green apples, citrusy, light biscuit, Bright. Taste is clean, citrisy, fruity, slight rart. Good stuff.

0.33 l bottle from ¬íRudat¬í, best before October 2024, cellared for over two years. Sourish, very funky and slightly fruity aroma of lots of barnyard, lemon, rhubarb, wood and some gooseberry. Above moderately sour, quite funky, dry and slightly fruity taste of barnyard, lemon, rhubarb, leather, wood and hints of gooseberry, followed by a medium long, rather tart, woody-dry finish. Medium body, quite astringent and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Really tasty, well-balanced and refreshing Lambiek, highly drinkable and not puckeringly sour.

On tap at Mikkeller bar Berlin as Mitte SpontanAle. 
Golden, clear, nearly no head.
Sour cherry, dog poo, Brett ,peach,
Fine carbonation, sour, astringent. Long aftertaste. Among the best Lambics I¬íve had.
Fette Stinkesocke der altd√§nischen Lambik School ‚ò∫. Winey, elegant & mit dem richtigen Sour Eier Griff üôÇ..hups sweety??? ‚ú® GREAT!!! MIKKELLER & FRIENDS. TAP.
Grapefruit and citrus. Clear golden pour. Tangy and crackery crisp finish like salt crackers that fermented. Tap at Mikkeller in Reykjavik.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. Znakomity nieblendowany lambik. Wytrawny, kwa≈õny, bardzo beczkowy, ≈õciƒÖgajƒÖcy na finiszu. Doskonale pijalny.

March 24, 2017. On tap at Mikkeller Stockholm. 
Light hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is funky and fruity with lemon, apples, hay, damp cellar, hints of oak, light cheesy notes. Taste is smooth sour, light funky. Medium bodied, slight oily texture with a smooth dry finish, soft to average carbonation. Finish is light sour fruity notes with citrus and a touch of green apple, light sweet malty touch. 
Simple and drinkable.

From tap at Mikkeller Haven Bar KBH with JU, ES and TB 29.03.17. Golden. Small and diminishing head. Standard lambic aroma and taste. Dry and medium sour. Competently made according to style, but a bit bland. Good drinkability.
Draft - Funky and sweaty with some soft grains. Clearish orange gold with a small white. Funk and light soured grain.
De geur is als een typische lambiek. De kleur troebel oranje. De smaak lekker zurig. Een aanrader voor wie van lambiek houdt.

20cl draught. Clear orange-brown with one finger white head. Funky aroma with citrus, hay and barnyard. Taste is funky citric with barnyard, hay and moderate acidity. Medium mouthfeel, light carbonation and funky acidic aftertaste with clean citrus.

Pours unclear blonde to amber. Small white head. Smell is bit sour. Funky, some ok. Taste is sour, bit acidic. Rather dry. Carbonated ( unblended lambic ????) Softly. Very oaky. Bit more harsh-sour, and not as complex or deep as the real lambics. I can say this has to be quite a good effort, and i¬ím mostly happy that he doesn¬ít actually call it lambic. Ratebeer does though... Time for a new style ???
From tap at Mikkeller in cop- sour light white wine-ish with pleasant sweetness
golden with small head; aroma is fruity sour with funk; taste is fruity with medium sweetness and funky sour finish; very nice

Sample from draft at mikkeller bar, poured a hazy deep golden colour with a slight white ring. Nose of faint malts, oak, cowwebs, brett, wet cellar, barnyard, white grapes and green apples. Tast is dry and tart, funk. Nice sour notes.

Keg @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Murky golden, small white head, rich lacing. Fruity aroma, ripe red apples and mild funk. Very soft and velvety mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Fruity taste, red apple, citrus zest, hay floral notes and mild funk.
On tap. Golden colour with white head. Fruity, apple aroma. Sweet, fruity, apple, sour and acidic taste. Medium body.
RBESG 2016 in Barcelona. On tap at Mikkeller Bar, as Mikkeller Spontan Exaimple. Golden colour. Sourish and oaky aroma. VERY sour and oaky flavour.

Draught at mikkeller Viktoria. 
Pours golden. 
Very tart taste of lemon and some barnyard.

Draft at mikkeller bar
Hazy yellow, small white head.
Nice sour cellar aroma. Fruity
Sour clean taste hint of organic feel. Slight bitter.

9th July 2016: on-tap in Mikkeller bar Barcelona with the RBESG guys. Labelled as Spontan Eixample. Clear golden pour, small white head. Sour and bitter with a tartness and farmyard ester or two. Aroma hinted at all the four flavours I mentioned at the start. Not really my thing.

Draught at Mikkeller Barrel Room, Copenhagen. As Refshale√∏en Spontan. Clear, orange colour with a thin, white head. Tart aroma with bretts, barnyard, sour fruits, berries, lightly wooden notes. Taste is sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft, lightly sparkling carbonation. Finishes dry and tart with sour berries and funky notes. Lovely Lambiek.

Clear golden with barely any head. Gooseberries, funk, hay, light wood, bitter herbs. medium sour and almost medium bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Good stuff, very similar to Boon unblended lambic.

Wonderful flavor of raspberries. Little bitterness which fills the front of the mouth a weak moment. Seems that the beer was better when it was cold. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Drucken som N√∂rrebro Spontanale. Klar orangegul √∂l med gulvitt skum. Doften √§r riktigt brettig med stall och h√§stfilt. Till detta kommer en syrlighet med inslag av citron. Fruktig, funkig syrlighet i smaken.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends, as N√∏rrebro Wit. Clear orangey with a small white head. Aroma light malty and sour (citrusy, spicy, fruity, acidic, tart). Flavor light sweet, sour, fruity, ending dry. Light body.

Draught as Mikkeller J√¶gerspontan @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours dark yellow with a small white head. Aroma iis light sour, yeast, barnyard, tart fruity, grapes, light vinegar. Flavor is rather sour, yeast, barnyard, tart fruity, white grapes, wet wood, little sugar, little vinegar. Medium body, average carbonation, acidic finish.Nice and easy to drink. 260616

Do tap. Cerveja laranja, l√≠mpida, praticamente sem espuma. Aroma c√≠trico, frutado e um pouco avinagrado. O sabor √© um pouco doce e √°cido, mas totalmente palat√°vel. Nota-se lim√£o, ma√ß√£, vinagre. Final seco. refrescante e de baixa carbonata√ß√£o.
The only thing this beer was lacking was that funky pungent aroma. Lots of sourness with a hint of fruit, this was my favorite of the Mikkeller beers of the trip.

What¬ís not to like about this?! Wonderful, entrancing aroma; good sour, acidity punch at the start, and plenty of yeasty goodness. Perhaps a little heavy at times, but compelling, too. (on tap at Mikkeller, Copenhagen)
Tap @mikkellerbar Viktoriagade. Nice expression of the spontan series. Semi clear orange, fresh and zesty nose. Taste is dry with sour fruity hints. Aftertaste is drying only slightly bitter. Clean!
Bottle. Copper color. Strong aroma of horseblanket, old grain, mild oak vanilla and funk. Tart taste of dry horseblanket, grain, bitter harshness and barnyard. Harsh and in your face.

Bottle at home poured into nosing glass. Pours hazy orange with little to no head. Light fruity and acidic. Taste is astringent sour bitterness and decent carbonation. Hints of aceton and floral finish.

Tasted from the tap on the 11/02/2016. Clear deep gold to orange with a small, thin head that dissipates quickly. Nice acidic aroma with presence of fruits. The problem is the sugar. Aftertaste is acid lemon and sugar. Next one please!
Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours amber. Nose of light funk. Taste is nice and crisp, very nicely balanced with very light lambic funk flavours. Great easy-drinking lambic.
From tap at Mikkeller Bar. Clear orange colour with a small head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, spice, fruit, acidic and tartness.

Draught. Clear amber in color, small head. Some garden apples and barnyard on the nose. The sour notes are there as well. Sour taste with some apples and funky notes. Leather and barnyard in the end. Dry and good.
Bottle. Somewhere between white wine and horse blanket. Light spicy, bitterish finish, a bit fruit stone-like. Not too sour actually. Likeable indeed.

Bottle bought @ The Mikkeller webshop (iirc). Pours tiny hazy golden with a small frothy and fizzy offwhite head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly malty, fruity and slightly funky with crackers, caramel, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, green apples, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard, horse-blanket, lemon zest and hints of smoke. Taste is sour, slightly malty, slightly fruity and slightly funky. Mouthfeel is soft, round, slightly dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is sour with sourdough crackers, white bread, caramel, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, overripe apples and pears, leather, cobwebs, hay, minerals, smoke, white pepper corns and lemon zest. Decent lambic with a rather prominent phenolic smokey spicy character. Not sure I¬ím a huge fan of that.
Just a lovely lambic with a perfect balance between the sour flavors, brettanomyces and fruity sweetness. A masterpiece!

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Clear deep gold to orange with a small, thin head that dissipates quickly. Gooseberry, lemon zest and light citrus on the nose with some cobwebs. Medium body with average carbonation. Finishes dry with a fruity sourness. Nice.
On tap at Mikkeller bar. Pours clear copper to yellow with almost no head to speak of. Aroma is lambic, grapefruit. Taste is sour with malt, grapefruit, lambic.

On tap at Mikkeller. 
Aroma is moderately acidic with some nice tropical fruit and cherry notes. Light oak note. Light toasted bread and cracker malt notes. A faint, earthy funk. 
Pours a hazy, dull copper color with a small, thick white head with good retention. Faint lacing and legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with some medium light oak notes. Some medium light tropical fruit, especially pineapple with some light citrus and cherry. Light earthy funk with a faint herbal quality. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a surprisingly nice sour beer. Nicely balanced oak, acidity, fruit and funk notes.

Orange durchscheinend tr√ºb kaum Schaum. Aroma von gr√ºner Apfel rote Johannisbeeren leicht Joghurt und rote orange. Trocken; sauer balanciert. Die s√§ure schneidet nicht. Nachtrunk harmonisch mit langsam ausklingender s√§ure
On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours light amber with small white head. Fruity aroma of light fruits, horse stable, effervescent powder, vanilla, coconut. Taste sour with some sweetness.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Reykjavik. As "Hverfisgata Spontanale". Aroma of fruits, green apples, citrus, vinegar, sour yoghurt. Flavour is medium to heavy sour. Nicely dry finish. Very enjoyable Lambic.
Barwa ciemnoz≈Çota, minimalna piana. Aromat kwachowy, fenolowy, owocowy. Smak mocno kwa≈õny, gorzkawy, s≈Çony w posmaku, prawdopodobnie jest metaliczno≈õƒá, fenolowy i w posmaku owocowy.
Pours golde honey with thin head. Faint Bret nose. Taste tart, flowery and Bret. Nice glass.

Bottle. All hazy orange with small white head, which leaves a small ring on the side. Aroma is mellow, yet packed with funk, leather, green apples. Hay, sweet mandarin, juicy. Quite funky. Taste is really funky, fresh, apples, green apples, juicy. Slight sweetness and some bready maltyness adds a layer of complexity. Medium body and long funky finish, slight dry.
Surprisingly dark golden brown beer, nearly no head. Nose of green apples, sour yougurt etc. Tart, dry and slightly funky taste with notes of fruit and white wine. Mmmm

Aroma of hay, horseblanket, light citrus, earthy with some leather, apricot, stonefruit. Taste is very light on funk, citrusy, spritzy and very easy going. A bit thin and not super high carbonation, but it¬ís supposed to be an unblended (but still carbonated).

Botella de 33 cl de el l√∫pulo tomada en Belmonte el 29-06-2015 (r133) con fech de cons preferente para antes 16-10-2024. color anaranjado con poca espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores √°cidos con toques de frutas naranja melocot√≥n. Dentro de su estilo bastante buena para repetir.

Bottle. Clear, yellow, no head. Aroma is sour, with barnyard, lemon, water from sour cucumbers (low level) and vinegar - I had lambics that smelled nicer. In taste much better than it smells - citrusy, ripe fruits, low oaky notes. Medium to high sourness, dry, high carbonation. In overall - quite nice.

375ml bottle (Zmogsala 2015, Vilnius)
Lovely classic lambic aroma. Classic, but also sweet. Very cookie cutter, but a decent mimic. Way too sweet, this is a million miles from what 3F/Cantillon/Boon call Lambic. Drinkability high. Lacticity very nice too, it keeps it easy to drink, and leaves both a milky breadiness and a gentle sourness.

tap @ Mikkeller & Friends Reykjavik, as "Hverfisgata Spontanale"
Light orange hazy beer with almost no head at all. Aroma and flavor have lemon juicy sourness and barnyardy funkiness. Medium thick sour palate with strong carbonation and bitterness. Finish has quite strong bitterness. Aftertaste is sour with lemon juice. Very sour. Does not taste like unblended at all, it¬ís so sparkling.

On tap @ Mikkeller, K√∏benhavn. Pours slightly hazy golden, with a small creamy head. Aroma is balsamic vinegar, wooden brett and oak, as well as white currants, rhubarb and tannins. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is nice and sour, with balsamic vinegar, berries, oak and currants.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, K√∏benhavn
Pours slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, yeast, berries and funk. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long berry, sour, dry and funky finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft

Tap at Mikkeller Bar 5th anniversary. Almost clear amber with a small white head. Aroma has oak, vanilla, gooseberry, vinegar, lemon. Taste is sour and dry with vinegar and some oaky vanilla. Light but tasty. Low carbonation.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Stefansgade. Light hazy orange still pour. Red apples, apple cider, musty leather, some peach and light bitterness. Juicy and delicious.

duft lime funk √¶ble fersken-
smag: √¶ble funk lime. fersken smager meget af √¶blemost

Bottle. Little hazy golden color, small white head. Aroma is barnyard, horse blanket, lemon, young sour grapes. Taste is medium sour and dry, bitter at finish. Flavors of citrus, grapes, floral. Aftertaste is tart and bitter. Very drinkable and balanced.

Tap @ the original mikkeller bar. Pours hazy orange amber with no head. Aroma is pretty funky with notes of vinegar, floral notes, sour grapefruit, green sour grapes and some barnyard. The taste is sour and has notes of sour grapefruit, dry vinegar, green grapes, wood and some red currants. Nice!

On tap at Mikkeller and Friends in Reykjavik. Clear amber pour with a white head. Nice sour/funk bouquet. Clean with really pleasant sour but somewhat mild funk notes. I get a bit of pickled undercurrents. Really pressure. Good body and mouthfeel.
draft at Mikkeller Bar, san Francisco, CA. Sold as Tenderloin Spontanale. apricot colored pour, tart fruitiness, acidic, vinegar, hint of apricot. nice tart limbic
On tap at Mikkeller Bar, SF. Sharp sour aroma. Sharp tart taste as well. Sour cherry, not too overpowering. Nice.

Bottled at Den Glade Dansken
Hazy golden. Small white head. 
Tart aroma. 
Sour flavour wih some sweetish vinegar.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden amber pour with a thin white head, decent funky aroma with a hint of apricot, taste has apple, lemon, some acidity, pleasantly sour, a decent funky little number.
Backlog. On tap at the Mikkeller Bar in San Francisco. Lightly sour, tart, fruity, crisp and refreshing. Pretty good overall.

Aroma: farmhouse, drupelet of white grapes, acid.
Appearance: golden clear color, no head.
Taste: only sour (like cherries), clear profile, maybe a little bit watery.
Palate: low body and high carbonation, sour finish.
Overall: Hard to say. From the one hand side this beer has a clear sour profile, but nothing more.
Pours a light golden color with a white head. Fruit, funk, yeast, tartal and malt aroma and flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation. Funk and tart finish.

Orange color with minimal head. Aroma has apple and sour funky elements. Taste is fruity and sour with very nice sour finish. Flavors of apple, vinegar. Very drinkable but tasty and interesting one.
W aromacie nuty dzikie, typowe dla lambikow. W smaku kwas, lekka slodycz, niska pelnia.
Draft at Mikkeller Bar Reykjavik as Hverfisgata Spontanale. Hazy straw yellow color, almost flat. Aroma of citrus. Taste is very tart but drinkable.

Tap at Mikkeller and Friends Reykjavik. Pours cloudy orange with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is lactic grapes, lemon zest and pale malt. Flavor is lactic grapes, lemon notes, pale malt and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
Flaska Bishops √∂rebro. Eldorange klar kul√∂r. Syrlig och sm√•tt s√∂tfruktig doft. Sur och frisk smak. Lite jordk√§llare, j√§st och h√∂. H√§rligt torr i gommen.
Bottle at Ash¬ís. Pours hazy orange amber, nose is funky, fruity, acidic, taste is quite tart, dry, acidic.

Pale solid cloudy golden brown, headless. Dank creamy berries. Real fresh tart juicy refreshment throughout. Vibing mouthfeel, decent carbonation and lean comfortable sweetness towards the finish. Glemaing tart linger. Lush. Bottle, Mikkeller Online, Ash¬ís Office Tasting
Bottle. Golden with white head. Dusty funky aroma, big sharp lambic shiz. Taste is super funky, sharp, fruity. Quite sour.

Bottle thanks to someone.
Appearance - golden with no head (much like BenH¬ís last relationship).
Nose - tangy apple vinegar.
Taste - more tangy apple and sour zingy notes.
Palate - a long lean tangy beer that is tight in texture but still deep in flavour.
Overall - authentic interpretation of the style.
Bottle at Ashton McCobb¬ís. Pours clear gold, light haze, no head. Aromas of light sour, sharp apples. Taste is sour, lambic, cherry. Sour finish.

Draft at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma is acidic with fruits, grapes, though not a very big smell. Taste is sweet and sour with a very fruity feature. Palate is thin though very tasteful and complex. Overall nice and easy beer. Tasteful yet very drinkable.
33cl bottle from cerveteca Lisboa, Portugal. Orange color. Hazy appearance. Thin head. Medium to high sourness, light sweetness. Aroma is hoppy, cheese, wood, fruity.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, pours light cloudy orange with no head. Aromas of vinegar, stable notes, tart fruity notes, pretty funky, citrus, apples. Taste is pretty citrussy, funk, stable, green apples, apple zest.

Clear warm golden colour, no real head. Barnyard aroma, lemon zest, leather, light wood. Light sour flavour, brett, funk, apricot. Finish apricot, lemon zest, tart notes, leather. Nice!
(from 33cL bottle @ home. As Vesterbro Spontan)
Klare dunkel goldgelbe Farbe, wenig wei√üer Schaum. Geruch fruchtig, holzig, s√§uerlich. Geschmack ziemlich s√§uerlich fruchtig, pelzig, leicht holzig
P√• fat hos Mikkeller Stockholm. Dimmig ljus b√§rnstensf√§rgad v√§tska med l√•gt vitt skum. Doftar surt. Rik sur smak med en bitter beska som s√§tter sig i gommen. S√∂tsur smak p√• l√§pparna. God!

330 ml. bottle sampled as ¬ìMikkeller Vesterbro Spontan¬î @ ¬ìNog-een-half-jaar-tot-de-volgende-EBT¬î. Pours orange, isntantly gone head. Huge barn, zest & funk nose, lots of oak, hay & white pepper. Taste is bitter zest, dried orange peel, lots of oak, hay, white pepper. Low carbonation. Really delicious. Mikkeller just keeps improving in the sour department it seems;

Bottle at "Nog-een-half-jaar-tot-de-volgende-EBT"- As Vesterbro SPONTAN (hope it¬ís the same).
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: sour, barnyard, leather, dry.
TASTE: dry, bitter, leather, barnyard.

Small rim over faintly hazed, orange-golden to copper beer. Slightly sourish nose with a bit of old oak. Sweet-sourish, faintly as Kantonese sauce with pineapple. Bit fruity indeed, not very lambic-y, but for a faint hint at (old) sherry. Bit acidburn all the same. Light body, tired feel. Oh, drinks away well, but again, this is not lambic.

Pours hazy straw with little head. Aroma of grass, white wine and lemons. An acidic taste with a dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours pretty much clear golden amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are brett, wood, and lemons - with a dry finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. 171214.


a bit sour aroma, orange colour with a tiny head. Not fantastic, just ok.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy amber color, white head. Sour taste with wheat, peach, citrus, yeast, acidic notes and grass. Sour finish with citrus, peach, yeast, acidic notes and grass. Excellent unblended lambic.

(Tap sample at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Nov 16 2014) Pours clear straw with a small white head, slight lace. Aroma has a lemony sourness with a bunch of oaky Chardonnay type notes, buttery, lemony, acidic with a light funk to it. On the palate, more acidic (lactic and a bit acetic), a bit of oak, wheaty, mineral sort of finish. Light and spritzy. This is a pretty decent, fairly lightly sour unblended lambic. Not the most complex beer, but pretty drinkable and refreshing, bit of a palate cleanser actually.

On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. As "Vasa Spontanale". Almost clear golden/amber with no head and no lacing. Aroma is of buttery oak, vanilla, light funk and lemony notes. Taste is moderately acidic (just the right amount) with oak and light funk. Medium body. Still. Oily mouthfeel. Oaky finish. Decent attempt at an Unblended Lambic. A tad heavy.

On tap at mikkeller Stockholm. Hazy gold pour with no head. Aroma is lemony, grainy, mild lambic funk. Taste is lightly acidic, not really tart, grain. Palate is med bodied, a bit heavy actually, med carbonation. Decent

Amber colour, small white head. Aroma is resin, some sour wood, mild herbal and earthy notes. Flavour is wooden, tart berries, some sour wood, mild earth and all this in a nice balance.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Named Vasa Spontanale. Sour smell with grapefruit. Similar taste. Refreshing and very nice. Love the tart flavour.

Tap at Mikkeller Sthlm as "Vasa Spontale". 
Slightly hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma has fruity wild yeast. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Bubblegummy, fruity tart flavor. Nice tartness, simple "session sour".
Overall: Sour wood, some stable. Modest funkyness.Note: On-tap at Mikkeller Bar. Reviewed 2014-09-17.
On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Orange, hazy, medium head. Sour smell, fruity (apple, raspberry). Sour/lactic taste, acidic, barnyard, medium bitterness. Sour/fruity finish, fizzy, full body.
S√§uerlicher Antrunk, deutlich fruchtig, frisch. Etwas Pfirsich, Limette, spritzig. Saures gutes Bier! 11/13/13/13//13

This Lambic is also aliased as the Vesterbro Spontanale. Poured a cloudy dark orange with a frothy head. Not being the biggest fan of this style, I was impressed at the balance achived, reminding me of reasonable champagne where it reminds others more of stomach acid.

On tap at Mikkeller Stockholm.
Hazy gold. Balanced crisp sourness, this is made by someone who knows his stuff. Rhubarb, lemon sherbet.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Light tart fruit and wild lambic aromas. Tart fruit tones, not overly sour or puckering. Flavors are subtle but nice finish .
Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Low off-white lasting white head. Hazy orange body. Vinegar grapefruit aroma and flavor. Sout but pleasant ande not too agressive. Low carbonation. Long finish.
Draft at Mikkeller Bar. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of tart fruits, light funk and barnyard. Flavour is moderate acidic. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends. Aroma is sour, grapefruit, brett. Hazy amber with virtually no head. Taste is sour, fruity brett. Moderate- sour and dry. Light body, dry oily feel, sour and light brett finish.

@ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm: riktigt trevlig syrlig doft av vindruvor. Smaken √§r syrlig och god med tydlig smak och l√•ng eftersmak. Riktigt gott. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!
Nose is decent barn yard, weak urinal cakes, little soap, unripe gooseberry, feel is mediumweak, taste is sweet apricot, pinot gris, later lemon acid

On tap at mikkeller viktoria. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma sour, barnyard, horse, manure, grapefruit and lemon peel. Taste is sour and very barny, grapefruit, manure and similar funky notes. Excellent beer!

Draught sample at the Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. Pours an hazy yellow with a medium head, aroma of brett, fresh and fruity, flavor is simply sour, fresh with notes of green tea, medium bodied. Great.

30th April 2014Mikkeller Vik. Keg. Almost clear gold beer, tiny white head. Palate is light and crisp and semi dry. Mild gueuzey lemon and wet wood, sweeter than expected. Tangy dried fruits. Light crisp finish. Refreshing and easy drinking.
Tap at the Mikkeller bar... Golden amber... Dey barnyard funk nose... Tart sour fruits... Zezty sour tart
Tap at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear orange, small, fizzy white head. Sour, funky aroma. Flavour is crisp, apples and lemon.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, february 14th 2014. Clear orange body, small white lacings. Aroma of barnyard, grapes, leather, grapefruit. Taste of grass, sour fruits, hay, apple juice. Dry bitter finish. Quite nice.
Drank as Vasa spontanale. Clear deep yellow orange color. Aroma of vinegar, fruity funk and some hay. Taste is sour with fruity and funky notes. Nice one!

On tap at Mikkeller bar Stockholm. Hazy light orange color with small almost white head. Nice "sour" funky barnyard aroma, with citrus fruits. Fruity sweet and bretty sour taste. Very refreshing and very nice.

Small glass at Mikkeller & Friends. Apricot-colored with almost no head. Aroma is really nice, gueuze-like: apricot, lemon, peach, hay. Taste is peach and lemon with puckering raspberry acidity. Delicious.

Quite sour funky beer although still easy to drink due to some malty backbone that gives it some body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yellow with just a hint of haze. Very nice funky barnyardy nose, pale malts. Refreshing body, dry, funky nice. Slightly tart finish. Excellent stuff. Very barnyardy given the age&abv.

Aroma and taste is barnyard fruity, prominent lemon, crisp, tartness on palate, acidic dry finish.

Pours hazy orange with a low tan head. Aroma is funk, citrus, honey, kiwi. Taste is citrus, honey, funk, kiwi. Mouthfeel is dry with a noticable carbonation. Aftertaste is funk, honey and citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy amber with low white head. Aroma of bretta, apples, green grapes. Taste is heavy tart, sour, grapey and rich. Crisp, light body with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How: Draught as Mikkeller Vasa Spontanale.
Where: Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, tart, grapefruit, stable.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Tart, citrus, sour, lemon, grapefruit.
Comment: Milder than Cantillon, not as sour, but still good.

Keg at Mikkeller Viktoriagade, 02/03/14.
Very lightly hazed golden with moderate off white edgeing.
Nose is tarte fruit, lemon rind, tarte grape skins, funk, straw, barnyard.
Taste comprises apple core, lemon rind, woody must, dank straw, horse blanket.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tarte tangy streaks in the close.
Solid lambic.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Unusually clean lambic with low bitterness for the style. High drinkability.

Keg at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm (as Vasa Spontanale).  Hazy golden, small coarse head. Citric cobweb aroma. Tart and light bodied with clean mouthfeel. Citric tartness, some hay and horseblanket. Lemony salty finish. Nice lambic-like flavours, but not as harmonious as the best traditional lambics.

Aroma: sour, fruity, apple cider. Appearance: slightly hazy, pale gold, hardly any head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: bitter dryness, cider notes, very bitter indeed, long, dry finish, light carbonation. Overall: a Lambic - not my favourite beer style, but this one is remarkably bitter. Pint at Milkeller Bar, Copenhagen.

On tap @ mikkeller bar. Ambrata velata con riflessi aranciati schiuma bianca un po¬í grossolana non molto persistente. Aroma agrumato, luppolo vecchio tipico delle lambic. Poco niente carbonata, acida secca. anche al gusto agrumata. Qualche nota di legno. Per essere unblended √® decisamente bevibile
@ Mikkeller & Friends. N√∏rrebro Spontanale. Fruktig men v√§ldigt syrlig. Torr och syrlig avslutning.

From keg @Mikkeller, Viktoriagade. Pours golden with a haze, topped by a layer of tiny white bubbles. Smell of clean pale malts, lemon peel, resin, grass, rhubarb and horse stable. Mid-bodied. Quite malty-sweet for the style. Also some fine sour/tart fruit tones. Lemon, unripe apples, rhubarb and a certain grassy bitterness. Dry finish with a tart mouthdrying fruitiness. Highly quaffable. [20.07.13]

Keg at Mikkeller. It pours clear gold with a small white head. The nose is acidic, barnyard, light sweetness, wood, funk, floral and light vanilla notes. The taste is tart, acidic. Sour lemon, barnyard, funk, white grape skin, wood, white wine vinegar and sherbet. Medium body and prickly carbonationa touch too much acidity if truth be told, but tasty nonetheless.

Tap. Pours hazy, deep golden with a small, lacing, off-white head. Aroma of barnyard, citrus, funk and wood notes. Sweet and acidic flavor that ends up tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily text. and flat to soft carb. An excellent and crisp sour.

Tap at Mikkeller. Pours vibrant hazy orange with a small white head. Nose and taste are very balanced barnyard notes with light funk and a touch of acidity. Super refreshing and quaffable. Great stuff

Cloudy orange small white head. Nice tart and sour, fresh. Flavor is very sour brderibg citric. Slightly leaning towards nailpolish like flavor bu it is not really there, it is overpowered by the very nice strong lambic flavor. Very quenching.

No head, light hazy and golden coloured beer. Noses of apple, sour pears and as lambic of cider notes with floral hoppy hints. Flat and light slick texture, medium sour/acidic with light faint sweet traces. Medium body. The finish is a bit slick, dry sweet and medium long.

Mikkeller, Copenhagen, Dk.
Tap, 260913.
Amber with small head. Aroma of sourness. Flavor with malt and fruit,

Draught @ Mikkeller bar. Clear light orange color, small white head. Aroma of sourness, citrus and sour red fruits. Taste moderately sour, grapepeel, sour red fruits, tart. Pretty balanced, nice one.

Tap at Mikkeller and Friends. Gold-orange with lace. Dusty barnyard nose, citrus, some yogurt, horse blanket. Flavor is very lemony with good funk and perfect level of sourness. Not overly sour. Very drinkable and delicious.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, CopenhagenHazy golden color with small creamy head. The funky aroma has a clear feety character. The mouthfeel is quite smooth; moderate acidity, sharp (positively) Brett character, with evident astringency, and plenty of bitter oranges and cedar.Almost like a true Lambic; Very good.
Holy cow, awesome sour on tap at Mikkeller bar in san francisco, not as good as RRBC Consecration but close.
On tap at MB. Clear golden with no head. Nice soft caramel green apple aroma and taste with a pleasant oaky and grassy finish. Good soft palate.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF. Pours golden with a decent off-white head and a sour fruit aroma. There is a subtle sour fruit flavor with a dry finish that sticks to the palate.
On tap at Mikkeller and friends. Pours a clear golden with a small head. Sweet and sour with fruity aromas. Hints of peach. Medium to light bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry, slightly sour finish.
H√§rlig och balanserad. L√§skande men med lite lagom kropp. Bra spontaning. Snor ett smakprov av Wall√©n
Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Tart and yeast aroma. Sour and yeast flavor with light tropical fruit. Medium bodied. Sour and yeast lingers with light fruitiness.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 10 July 2013) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, sourish nose with grapefruit, citrus, green grapes and hints of apple juice. Fruity, tart taste with notes of apple juice, grapefruit and a touch of stable. Medium body, quite dry. The fairly balanced sourness makes it quite drinkable and refreshing. Nice one.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy barnyard, horse blanket, tart, citrus, light wood. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, fruity, tart, funky, sharp, refeshing, leather, light barnyard. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20130225]

Draught at Mikkeller&Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy golden beer with a small head. Grassy floral aroma, sour, grapefruit, rubber notes, a bit funky. Fruity sour flavor, rubber, grapefruit, hay, dandelions, some woody notes, funky, some grass. Sour fruity rubber finish. Kinda balanced beer.
Fresh, sour and fruity. Clear amber with small hints of white head. Sour lambic, attacks your tongue. Bitter and dry. Nice lambic.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy tart weak funky aroma. Fruity malty spicy slightly tart citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus tart sour finish.

Draught. Good acetic aroma. Cloudy orange colour. Small white head. The flavour is also really nicely acetic, has a hint of mild lemon. Dry and a little flat finish, but still has a lingering fruitiness. Flavourful yet quaffable.

Hazy amber with a thin white head. Acidic taste with hints of lime and leather.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy orange with thin white crown. Lemon rind, yeast funk, light cheesiness, dust, and lime in the aroma. Plenty of tasty critic tartness in the taste, barnyard, leather, dust, light sweatiness, light vinegar. Well balanced, nice and sour but not overpowering. Great stuff.
Draught. Amber coloured. Unclear. Dense off White head. Aroma. Sourness, grape, leather tart, Light barn. Flavour. Sourness, funk, grape, tart. Medium to full bodied. Ends sourish.

Keg at Mikkeller & Friends - Copenhagen. Pours hazy gold with a fine, white cream head. Pretty solid, classic lambic aroma, lots of crisp grass, some good funk. Light to medium sweet flavor with assertive grassy bitterness, but it¬ís not abrasive, sour but not lip-puckering. Light to medium bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Clean finish with moderate bitter grass, good and balanced tartness, offsetting sweetness. Really nicely balanced lambic.
Draught. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy nice sour aroma. MOderate bitter nice sour flavor. Average finish. Oily palate.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 06.05.2013, tap @ Mikkeller & Friends as N√∏rrebro Spontanale:
Frisk lett syrlig lukt med preg av lys malt, humle, syregras, sitrusskal, gras, sitron, tre, h√∏y. Frisk lett beisk smak med preg av lys malt, humle, sitrusskal, syregras, sitron, r√• rabarbra, tre, gras. Middels bitterhet som set litt. Veldig god.

[4/30/13] Draught at Mikkeler & Friends in Copenhagen. As N√∏rrebro Spontanale. Hazy orange. Bretty aroma with floral and citric hints, manure notes, sweat and earthy notes. Sour flavor, a bit harsh at first, somewhat lemony, a bit acetic. Finishes sour and bitter with some grapefruit rinds. Medium-bodied. Pretty nice.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, pours a hazy golden orange with a small off-white head. Aroma of dry tart fruits, some pleasantly stale stone fruits, and strange herbal notes. Flavour brings out super dry tart fruits, dry oak barrels, and funky earthy notes. Very complex, dry and funky. Tastes very authentically lambic-like, exactly like an unblended lambic should. Excellent stuff.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a white head. Aroma of sour apricot, wood and citrus. Flavour of strong sour apricot, caramel, wood, grassy hops and hay. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a sour berry finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends.
Pours hazy orange color with a small head. Aroma of sour fruits, barnyard notes, lemon and some floral notes, mild yeast too. Flavour of apricot, grape fruits, goose berries and yeast. Nice and sour.
2356

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen
Pours dark orange with a tiny head. Aroma of tart berries, some sourness and yeasty notes. Taste is smooth, mildly sourish with tart berry notes. Finish is smooth and carbonated. Okay, quite easy to drink, "light" gueuze.
Tart, lactic, sour, easy drinking golden ale. Draft pour was excessively expensive but it is nice.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are leather, stable, brett, malt and hops. Nice sour finish, but not a plaque remover.
I have never tasted anything that tastes this awfull. Awwfullll. I am not sure this is real beer.

12-APR-2013, tap @Mikkeller & Friends, with Marianne.
Hazy golden with white head.
Tart aroma with fruit and wood.
Taste the same. Very citric. Not overly sour and sweet notes as well.
Medium body, soft carbonation. Easy drinking. Not on of the great sours.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, April 2013.

A bit hazy golden with a small white head. Fruit, grape, wood and some barnyard. Rather soft tartness in this one, easy to drink and refreshing. The finish was dry. A tasty one.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph. Pours clear golden with a small, white film head. Aroma has funk, fairly lactic, apple peel and oranges. Highish carbonation, nice dry and light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is pleasantly tart, apple, fairly lactic, subdued citric. Very low on vinegar which makes it very drinkable. Apples shines throughout. Very nice even if the lactic notes get a bit much.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoria. Slightly hazy deep golden with off-white head. Aroma is malt, tart, fruit and barnyard. Flavour is malt, tart, barnyard, fruit, little acid, little wheat, little citric and a little citrus.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, citrus and barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 150313

From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours cloudy orange with a fully gone head. Aroma is barnyard and orange citric to fruity. Fruity, citric, barnyard, brett and orange to grapefruity. Bitter and citric dry finish.
Draft. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of horseblanket,  brett, and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, lemons, and brettanomyces, leading to a tart finish.

No head dark orange. 
Has a rodenbach / Flemish nose. Cherries. Some grapes and lemon peels. Hint of oak
Mouthfeel is a bit thin and bitter. Not as dry as expected
Very tart. Not all that sour except for the middle. Lots of grape and oak characters. Some citrus and a lot of grassiness 
Light carbonation that stings.
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Clear amber - white head. Nice sourish. Wooden. Acid notes. Grape like notes. Mellow sourness. Fruity. Light acid. Smooth. Lovely.

Chopp. Unclear golden colour, quite small head, short lasting. Tart fruity barn aroma. Ok mouthfeel. Fruity tart barn flavour, citri Fruity and light acidic aroma of barnyard and citrus in the tart fruity finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Clear amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of barnyard and citrus.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of barnyard with notes of citrus.
Tart finish.

On tap. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. The aroma is fruity and acidic with some hoppy and malty notes. The flavour is tart and acidic with some fruity notes. Great authentic tart feel. Very dry grapefruity finish.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear golden with a small bubbly head. Barnyard, funk, lemon, oak and citrus. Crisp, dry and refreshing with a fine complexity. Impressive and delicious.
